trans-unit.source: White Papers on Azure
The white papers listed below provide additional views and perspectives on Azure services.
(in order of popularity)
Security Best Practices For Developing Azure Applications
This paper focuses on the security challenges and recommended approaches to design and develop more secure applications for Microsoft's Azure platform.
Azure Security Overview
This paper describes the array of controls implemented within Azure, so customers can determine if these capabilities and controls are suitable for their unique requirements.
Single Sign-On from Active Directory to an Azure Application Whitepaper

This paper contains step-by-step instructions for using Windows Identity Foundation, Azure, and Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS) 2.0 for achieving SSO across WEB applications that are deployed both on premises and in the cloud.
Azure Table - Programming Table Storage

This paper describes Azure Table, which is the structured storage provided by the Azure platform. It supports massively scalable tables in the cloud, which can contain billions of entities and terabytes of data.
A Developer's Guide to Service Bus for the Azure AppFabric
This paper focuses on how you can use the Service Bus to overcome some of the most common Internet connectivity challenges inherent in today's world.
Azure Queue - Programming Queue Storage
This paper describes Azure Queue, and how to use it to provide a reliable message delivery mechanism.
Azure Drive Whitepaper - Using a Durable Drive for your NTFS Cloud Applications
This paper describes Azure Drive, and how to use it to provide durable NTFS volumes for Azure applications.
Introducing Azure
This paper introduces Azure, Microsoft's cloud platform that allows developers to run applications and store data on virtual machines in an internet-accessible data center.
Azure Blob - Programming Blob Storage
This paper describes Azure Blob, and how to use it to enable applications to store large objects, up to 50GB each, in the cloud.
The Azure Programming Model
This paper discusses the benefits of Platform as a Service cloud offering and how it is implemented within Azure.
Similarities and Differences - SQL Azure vs. SQL Server
This paper highlights the similaries and differences between SQL Azure and SQL Server. It also covers the benefits of using SQL Azure as a database service in the cloud.
IT as a Service

This paper discusses how Azure complements Windows Server, and how together, they allow enterprises, regional service providers, and Microsoft itself to deliver applications across private and public clouds with a consistent identity, management, and application architecture.
Security Guidelines for SQL Azure
This paper provides an overview of security guidelines for customers who connect to SQL Azure Database, and who build secure applications on SQL Azure.
An Introduction to Azure AppFabric for Developers

This paper provides a quick introduction to Azure Platform AppFabric, which includes Service Bus and Access Control and provides common building blocks required by .NET applications when extending their functionality to the cloud, and specifically, the Azure platform.
Azure and ISVs - A Guide for Decision Makers
This paper discusses how using the cloud has the potential to increase an ISV's revenues and decrease its costs.
Cloud Optimization - A framework for making business decisions about cloud computing
This paper discusses how cloud computing provides organizations with new ways to deploy and maintain enterprise applications - allowing for greater flexibility and reduced complexity.
Azure AppFabric Overview
This paper introduces Azure AppFabric, a comprehensive cloud middleware platform for developing, deploying, and managing applications on the Azure platform.
Cloud Economics
This paper assesses the economics of the cloud by using in-depth modeling, and then uses this framework to better understand the long-term IT landscape.
System Integrator Whitepaper

This paper describes how Microsoft system integrator partners are using Azure to develop applications and services that are quick to deploy, easy to manage, readily scalable, and competitively priced.
Cloud Platforms for Business Leaders
This paper looks at the benefits and the risks of cloud platforms from a business perspective. To make good decisions, you need to appreciate both.
Overview of Microsoft SQL Azure

This paper describes how SQL Azure provides a robust and cost-effect solution for building applications on large or shared data sets, providing on-demand scalable data storage, and augmenting on-premise data infrastructure with low-cost, rapidly provisioned cloud-based storage.
Custom IIS Web/Microsoft SQL Server Application Migration Scenario
This paper describes the IIS/SQL Server application architectural pattern and illustrate specific considerations and suggested approaches for migrating applications with this or similar patterns.
Custom Web (Rapid Scaling Focus) Application Migration Scenario

This paper describes the Custom WEB application (Rapid Scaling) architectural pattern and illustrate specific considerations and suggested approaches for migrating applications with this or similar patterns.
Custom E-Commerce (Elasticity Focus) Application Migration Scenario

This paper describes the Custom E-Commerce Application (Elasticity Focus) architectural pattern and illustrate specific considerations and suggested approaches for migrating applications with this or similar patterns.
Developing and Deploying with SQL Azure
This paper provides guidelines on how to deploy an existing on-premise SQL Server database into SQL Azure. It also discusses best practices related to data migration.
